    • Method Detail

      • loocv

        public static void loocv(String libfmPath,
                         String inputPath,
                         String outputPath,
                         int nFactors,
                         int userCol,
                         int itemCol)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Leave-one-out cross validation using input CSV file.
        Parameters:
        libfmPath - The file path of the libFM executable.
        inputPath - The input file path
        outputPath - The file path for saving the prediction results.
        nFactors - The number of latent factors used in libFM.
        userCol - The column number of users in the input CSV file.
        itemCol - The column number of items in the input CSV file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs at file IO.
        See Also:
        "Cross-validation (statistics)" on Wikipedia

      • loocv_db

        public static void loocv_db(String libfmPath,
                            String tableName,
                            String outputPath,
                            int nFactors,
                            String userField,
                            String itemField)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Leave-one-out cross validation using remote DB data.
        Parameters:
        libfmPath - The file path of the libFM executable.
        tableName - which table in the DB contains the data.
        outputPath - The file path for saving the prediction results.
        nFactors - The number of latent factors used in libFM.
        userField - The data field corresponding to user ID.
        itemField - The data field corresponding to item ID.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs at file IO.
        See Also:
        "Cross-validation (statistics)" on Wikipedia

      • rmse

        public static double rmse(String filepath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Compute RMSE for an output file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - file path where the prediction results are saved
        Returns:
        The RMSE computed from the prediction results.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs when reading the file
        See Also:
        The mathematical definition of RMSE

      • recommendTopNForUsers

        public static void recommendTopNForUsers(String libfmPath,
                                         String inputPath,
                                         String outputPath,
                                         int nFactors,
                                         int userCol,
                                         int itemCol,
                                         int N)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Recommend a top-N list of items for each user using data from CSV file.
        Parameters:
        libfmPath - The file path of the libFM executable.
        inputPath - The input file path
        outputPath - The file path for saving the prediction results.
        nFactors - The number of latent factors used in libFM.
        userCol - The column number of users in the input CSV file.
        itemCol - The column number of items in the input CSV file.
        N - The number of items to be recommended to this user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs at file IO.
